bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Neva Pauline Hough, August 26, 1940

div1.p: Hench requests copies of architectural drawings of the Lazear Building and for permission to quote a statement concerning Lazear's relationship to Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Neva Pauline Hough, August 26, 1940
div1.opener:
August 26, 1940
Miss Neva P. Hough
President's Office
Washington and Jefferson College
Washington, Pennsylvania
My dear Miss Hough:
div1.p:
I am anxious to send Dr. Hutchison a memorandum for his
perusal, probably before his return from New Hampshire. Do you know the
expected date of his return? What is his New Hampshire address?

Will you please send to me several copies (ten or twelve,
if possible) of the architect's drawing of the Lazear Chemistry Building?
I am anxious to send them to interested persons who are helping me in my
historical researches on the yellow fever experiments, including members of
the Cuban government who are also planning a Lazear memorial in Cuba, and
several persons in this country who were closely associated with Lazear
during the yellow fever experiments. If you have no other photograph available,
perhaps you could send me the one as given on page 7 of the Alumni Bulletin
for November, 1939.

May I incorporate verbatim, the comments you sent me on
Dr. Lazear and his career at Washington and Jefferson, and what was the source
of your information. Has this and other material concerning his life at Washington
and Jefferson been published?
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
